clipboardHistory.value: # Add all changes (including new files, modified files, and deleted files)
# Adjust if your main branch is called 'master' or something else
# Branch to push to (e.g., main, master)

# Path to your Git repository (e.g., /home/youruser/dotfiles)
# If the script is placed inside the repo, you can use '.'
# Adjust this to your actual repository path

#!/bin/bash

# Define the directory to monitor
GIT_REPO_DIR="/home/dhruv/DEV"

# Change to the Git repository directory
cd "$GIT_REPO_DIR" || exit

# Check if there are changes
if ! git diff-index --quiet HEAD --; then
  # There are changes, so add and commit
  git add .
  git commit -m "Auto commit on system startup: $(date)"

  # Push the changes to the remote repository
  git push origin main # or `git push origin master` depending on your branch name
fi

#!/bin/bash

# --- Configuration ---
# Path to your Git repository (e.g., /home/youruser/dotfiles)
# If the script is placed inside the repo, you can use '.'
REPO_PATH="/home/youruser/.config" # Adjust this to your actual repository path

# Branch to push to (e.g., main, master)
BRANCH="main" # Adjust if your main branch is called 'master' or something else

# Remote name (usually 'origin')
REMOTE="origin"

# --- Script Logic ---
echo "Starting daily Git backup at $(date)"
echo "Repository: $REPO_PATH"

# Change to the repository directory
cd "$REPO_PATH" || { echo "Error: Could not change to repository directory. Exiting."; exit 1; }

# Add all changes (including new files, modified files, and deleted files)
git add .

# Get current date for commit message
COMMIT_DATE=$(date +"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
COMMIT_MESSAGE="Daily automated backup: $COMMIT_DATE"

# Check if there are any changes to commit
if git diff-index --quiet HEAD --; then
    echo "No changes detected. Skipping commit."
else
    # Commit changes
    git commit -m "$COMMIT_MESSAGE"
    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
        echo "Error: Git commit failed. Exiting."
        exit 1
    fi
    echo "Changes committed successfully."

    # Push to remote
    git push "$REMOTE" "$BRANCH"
    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
        echo "Error: Git push failed. Exiting."
        exit 1
    fi
    echo "Changes pushed successfully to $REMOTE/$BRANCH."
fi

echo "Daily Git backup finished."
exit 0
git push origin main # or 'master' depending on your branch name
git commit -m "Clean up dotfiles: remove cached/unimportant directories based on .gitignore"
# Assuming this is another electron-based app

# --- Explicitly Include ---
# Files/directories that often *are* configuration and you generally want to track.
# (These are NOT in the .gitignore, meaning they *will* be tracked by Git)
# alacritty/ # Terminal emulator config - typically tracked
# clipse/    # Assuming it's a config for an editor/IDE
# environment.d/ # System-wide env vars - typically tracked
# fastfetch/ # Config files for fastfetch - typically tracked
# fish/      # Fish shell configuration - typically tracked
# ghostty/   # Terminal emulator config - typically tracked
# hypr/      # Hyprland compositor config - typically tracked
# mako/      # Notification daemon config - typically tracked
# mimeapps.list # Default applications mapping - can be useful
# nvim/      # Neovim config - almost always tracked
# waybar/    # Waybar

# --- Other General Cache/State Directories ---
# If these contain subdirectories that you *do* want to track (e.g.,
# 'alacritty/themes'), you might need more specific rules.
kdeconnect/
omarchy/
swayosd/
uwsm/
walker/

# --- Browsers and Electron Apps ---
1Password/
BraveSoftware/
chromium/
chromium-flags.conf # This *could* be useful, but often regenerated or user-specific
Code/
Electron/
elecwhat/ # Assuming this is another electron-based app
google-chrome/
google-chrome-beta/
google-chrome-unstable/
microsoft-edge-dev/
obsidian/
Signal/
vivaldi/
vivaldi-snapshot/

# --- System-level Caches & State ---

dconf/
fcitx/
fcitx5/
fontconfig/
ibus/
pulse/
systemd/
user-dirs.dirs
user-dirs.locale

# --- Large Applications / Data Directories ---

github-copilot/
kdenlive-layoutsrc # User-specific layout
kdenliverc          # User-specific settings, often changes a lot
mpv/
nautilus/ # Often contains extensions or user-specific state that isn't config
Pinta/
qBittorrent/
spotify/
Typora/
xournalpp/
yay/ # Package manager cache/build dir

# --- Specific Tool Caches / Logs ---
# These are often temporary or non-essential for configuration sync.
btop/ # Often contains cache/history
lazygit/ # Cache/history/session
neofetch/ # Often cache files


# --- Other General Cache/State Directories ---
# If these contain subdirectories that you *do* want to track (e.g.,
# 'alacritty/themes'), you might need more specific rules.
kdeconnect/
omarchy/
swayosd/
uwsm/
walker/

# --- Desktop Environment / Theme Caches ---
gtk-3.0/
gtk-4.0/

# --- Explicitly Include ---
# Files/directories that often *are* configuration and you generally want to track.
# (These are NOT in the .gitignore, meaning they *will* be tracked by Git)

# mako/      # Notification daemon config - typically tracked
# mimeapps.list # Default applications mapping - can be useful
# nvim/      # Neovim config - almost always tracked

# These applications tend to store significant amounts of user data,
# caches, or sometimes even application binaries themselves.

bindd = SUPER, T, Activity, exec, $terminal -e btopdd

# Learn how to configure Hyprland: https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/

# Use defaults Omarchy defaults (but don't edit these directly!)
source = ~/.local/share/omarchy/default/hypr/autostart.conf
source = ~/.local/share/omarchy/default/hypr/bindings/media.conf
source = ~/.local/share/omarchy/default/hypr/bindings/tiling.conf
source = ~/.local/share/omarchy/default/hypr/bindings/utilities.conf
source = ~/.local/share/omarchy/default/hypr/envs.conf
source = ~/.local/share/omarchy/default/hypr/looknfeel.conf
source = ~/.local/share/omarchy/default/hypr/input.conf
source = ~/.local/share/omarchy/default/hypr/windows.conf
source = ~/.config/omarchy/current/theme/hyprland.conf

# Change your own setup in these files (and overwrite any settings from defaults!)
source = ~/.config/hypr/monitors.conf
source = ~/.config/hypr/input.conf
source = ~/.config/hypr/bindings.conf
source = ~/.config/hypr/envs.conf
source = ~/.config/hypr/autostart.conf

# NVIDIA environment variables
env = NVD_BACKEND,direct
env = LIBVA_DRIVER_NAME,nvidia
env = __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME,nvidia

#decorations
source = ~/.config/hypr/dhruv/edit.conf
sudo pacman -Syu --needed base-devel git curl python python-pip libvips
